IX.iii.1.J.4.b
.
Example:  When to Consider the Bright-Line for Net Worth
Example
:  The beneficiary submits a claim for an income adjustment on June 23, 2022, however, information submitted shows the claimant has more net worth than originally reported on the original application.  Development is completed and evidence shows the claimant’s net worth was $110,000 as of the original effective date, May 9, 2016.  The net worth as of June 22, 2022 is $99,000.
Result
:  Although a formal administrative net worth decision would have been completed during 2016, the utilization of the bright-line limit is based on the date a claim is received.  The claimant’s net worth of $110,000 should be evaluated based on the net worth limit of $123,600 for all effective dates of payment prior to December 1, 2018.  The claimant’s current net worth should be evaluated based on the December 1, 2021, bright-line limit of $138,489.  Net worth is not excessive for VA pension.
title: M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section J - Net Worth, Asset Transfers, and Penalty Periods
